meanings.definition: To set below or beneath something.
meanings.sent1: She undersets the vase on the table.
meanings.sent2: He always undersets the books neatly on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The cat likes to undersets its toys under the couch.
meanings.sent4: The roots of the tree undersets the ground like anchors.
meanings.sent5: The foundation undersets the entire building, keeping it stable.

meanings.definition: A support or foundation placed beneath something.
meanings.sent1: The undersets provided stability to the structure.
meanings.sent2: The undersets were made of strong concrete.
meanings.sent3: The tiny undersets held up the heavy table surprisingly well.
meanings.sent4: The undersets acted like a safety net for the fragile glassware.
meanings.sent5: The undersets were essential for the bridge to withstand the weight of the cars.
